channel.title: Tips on NijiGPen Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Tips on NijiGPen Documentation

item.title: Scene Setup
item.description: Scene Setup # Blender comes with a template start file “2D Animation” that is convenient for painting. However, there are also some tricky parts in setting up the scene, especially when we put Grease Pencil and 3D objects in the same scene, including the meshes generated by this add-on. Here are some tips written in the form of FAQ. Why cannot I see any shading effect when I generate meshes from Grease Pencil?

item.title: Limitations
item.description: Limitations # The add-on has a number of limitations in different aspects, including: Unfinished features of the add-on itself, which may be improved in future releases. Limitations due to Blender’s own design, which may lead to different behaviors from common graphics software. Shape of a Stroke # The performance of the add-on may deteriorate with input strokes of certain shapes: Please avoid using self-overlapping strokes. Unlike common vector formats such as SVG, Blender does not define a fill rule and the rendering of the overlapping parts cannot be guaranteed.
